verb.description: Bend one's head or body forward and downward.
examples: he stooped down and reached toward the coin
Linda stooped to pick up the bottles

verb.description: Lower one's moral standards so far as to do something reprehensible.
examples: she was unwilling to believe that anyone could stoop so low as to steal from a dead woman

verb.description: (of a bird of prey) swoop down on a quarry.

noun.description: A posture in which the head and shoulders are habitually bent forward.
examples: a tall, thin man with a stoop

noun.description: The downward swoop of a bird of prey.

origin: Mid 18th century: from Dutch stoep (see stoep).
